title: Funzione cartelle unificate
content: Ho aggiornato Thunderbird da poco, ho la versione 115.3.1 su linux mint 20.3. Andava tutto bene quando una di queste mattine il client si è aperto, mi dava l'intestazione e la barra di stato, ma tutto il resto era bianco. Ho utilizzato la funzione "Modalità risoluzione problemi" e ho riportato il client come se fosse in impostazioni di fabbrica. Il problema è che ora anche se visualizzo tutto bene non ho più le cartelle unificate. La posta in arrivo è in tutti gli account in modo separato e la consultazione è alquanto fastidiosa e difficile. Premetto che prima di questo problema e dopo l'aggiornamento tutto funzionava bene, non so cosa sia successo. Ora anche se provo a spuntare la modalità "Cartelle unificate" viene spuntata sul momento ma non succede nulla e se rientro per vedere la indicata modalità il segno di spunta è sparita; ho anche provato a mettere il segno di spunta e riavviare il client ma non è cambiato nulla. Ho cercato in internet qualche soluzione ma non ha funzionato nulla. Non so più che pesci prendere. Grazie a chi vorrà aiutarmi.
creator: e.ru2208

title: výsledky hledání zpráv
content:
Ahojky, po poslední aktualizaci, kdy se toho tedy hodně změnilo :) se mi po vyhledání zpráv (Ctrl+K) podle emailu zobrazí panel stejně jako dříve s vyhledanými zprávami. Když kliknu na zprávu, kterou chci zobrazit, nerozbalí se jedna vybraná zpráva, ale v novém panelu se otevře celá komunikace (pokud byla) tedy všechny zprávy ve vlákně (ale ne podle vláken, to mám vypnuté, jen pod sebou). Pak musím konkrétní zprávu znovu vyhledat a následně teprve zobrazit.

Rád bych původní variantu, kdy se hned otevřela konkrétní zpráva z vyhledaného seznamu, mezikrok je zbytečný, chci jen tu konkrétní zprávu.

Děkuji za pomoc/radu :) Luky
creator: weber.lukas

title: Lastest Thunderbirds shows all threads expanded?
content:
Folks - I really like the threads features, started using it by setting some options months ago. If I minimized (or expanded) a thread, it stayed that way: either thru a Thunderbird restart, or just returning to the same folder. It seemed to remember.

Sometime in the last few updates, I'm noticing all threads are fully expanded. I can minimize them, but if I go to another folder, and then come back -- they are again expanded.

This is a bit annoying, is there a setting I can change? Thanks! jOHN
creator: john981

title: Why is there no button to sync/refresh everything
content:
First things first, I do know about the button on the top left that synchronizes my emails. But it doesn't seem to work for folders.

I noticed the problem when I went to my server, changed the location of a folder (moved it under another one) and then went back to thunderbird. Of course, the folder didn't automatically change but I was ok with that, but to my surprise when I hit the button on the top left, I found out that nothing changed (And clicking on the folder that I moved gave a "this folder doesn't exist on the server" type of message).

After reading this thread: https://support.mozilla.org/bm/questions/1113404

I realized that this problem has existed for years, I minimized the email, went to another email (like the thread implies as the best solution, clicked on the local folders as well and then returned to the email that I was working on. And like magic the folder in front of my eyes moved under the other folder. That means that closing and reopening thunderbird would work as well, but I really don't think that should be a solution. Other programs like outlook show you that they are also searching for changes in the folders as well when you hit the sync button. Why is there no similar functionality in thunderbird?
creator: georgekalan29

title: There are non-ASCII characters in the local part of the recipient address
content:
I keep getting this error message

"Sending of the message failed. There are non-ASCII characters in the local part of the recipient address and your server does not support SMTPUTF8. Please change this address and try again."

I do not use non-ASCII characters. The emails are sent but I have to delete the error message each time.

How can I fix this?

title: Trasferire account posta con tutte le sottocartelle.
content: Buongiorno, devo trasferire un account con tutte le sottocartelle di posta da un pc a un altro su cui esistono già altri account. La dimensione è superiore a 2G e il mio timore è che facendo la copia manuale oltre a trasferire account di cui non mi interessa (thunderbird nel pc da cui trasferire include diversi account di posta che devono restare dove sono) ho il dubbio che si possa sovrascrivere sul nuovo pc dove , ripeto, esistono altri account di posta che intendo conservare con la loro storia. Mi dite come fare senza perdere niente, grazie. Pino
creator: pinotraina

title: Deleting eMail Attachments
content:
Dear Sir or Madame,

The usual process that happened when deleting or separating attachments from e-mails was that a copy of the email without the attachment was produced by Thunderbird and the original email was deleted.

This is not longer working. When I delete an attachment, the original email containing the attachment is not deleted. So I have two versions of the email in my postbox, one with the attachment, the other without.

Probably I'm missing a setting?

Thunderbird version 115.3.3 (32-Bit)

Sincerely yours, Markus Piotrowski
creator: Markus.Piotrowski

title: Thunderbird v115 Unresponsiveness and Crashes.
content:
Issue Description: I frequently encounter unresponsiveness and application crashes while using Thunderbird version 115 and subsequent updates. Even in the latest version, such as v115.4.1, the problem persists. I would like to know what measures should be taken to resolve this issue.

Operating System: Windows 7 Professional 64-bit

Please note that I have tried multiple versions of Thunderbird, and this issue occurs consistently across multiple installations. It hinders my ability to effectively manage my email using Thunderbird. I am looking for relevant support and solutions to address this problem.

Thanks.
creator: mis2

title: 5 of my 6 sbc-yahoo emails in Thunderbird work but one does not.
content: 5 of my 6 sbc-yahoo emails downloaded to Thunderbird work but one does not. Thunderbird says it is in the system but when i look at passwords and account lists there, it does not show the account. I tried adding the account in Thunderbird, but says incoming server already exists, but, as said, it does not show in the email /passwords list! I am using ATT mailkeys for the passwords for each account in thunderbird. The non-working email is rudjnk@sbcglobal.net Suggestions? My email to contact is rudmail2@sbcglobal.net. Thanks for suggestions. Rudy
creator: astrorudy1rud

title: Sending from a Microsoft 365 account generates Windows Security popup
content:
I have several email accounts, one of which is hosted via Microsoft 365. Every time I send an email from that account, Windows Security opens up a dialogue box, asking me to select a certificate for authentication onto smtp.office365.com. It offers a Microsoft Your Phone certificate (see image attached),which works OK, but being Windows, the dialogue box opens behind the other open apps without any further notifcation - and if I'm busy, I won't notice it, and the email won't be sent.

I've tried installing the certificate, but that hasn't changed anything.

I've also attached a screenshot of my SMTP settings.

Can anyone suggest a permanent solution?

Thanks in advance.
creator: humphries.edwin

title: Thunderbird 115 Bullet Issues
content: I guess I can report bugs here. Anyway, when trying to create an email, and using the "Bullet" option, I install a bullet, then when I try to put a word in bold or regular text, the text jumps above the bullet. Also, when typing a line that is not bold, if I have to backspace for a spelling error, it turns the font to bold every time. It seems there are a lot of bugs when writing emails now. Try using "bullets" in an email and try to type behind that bullet and see what happens.
creator: GuardianoftheIdiots

title: How can I view my mail ordered by size of attachment?
content:
I've installed Thunderbird 115.4.1 on my ancient Macbook pro, in hope of getting to grips with my gmail (which I previously read using Firefox web gmail). There are over 20,000 messages, and I want to find and delete ones with BIG attachments. Is there a way to order my view by attachment size?

The sort-by option lets me choose 'attachments', so emails with attachments are listed above those without, but the list is still ordered by date, and the attachment size is shown only per email when the message is selected.

Any clues much appreciated.. thanks Alan
